trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> that holds the content of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document.
An XpsDocument contains a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence> that comprises one or more <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements.

The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor is passed a reference to a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> for writing, storing, and reading the content elements of the document.
A new empty [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is created by using the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

An existing [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is opened by using the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Open%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

A <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence> root is added to an empty [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.AddFixedDocumentSequence%2A> method.

<xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> elements with printer information and control can also be associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence>, or on individual <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> elements that are stored in the XpsDocument.

For more information about [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] see the XML Paper Specification (XPS) available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> class with access to a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> and default interleaving, resource, and compression options.
The target [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_metro](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-metro-md.md)] package for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> class that is contained in a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> with specified default interleaving, resource, and compression options.
The target package for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The package compression option.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> class that is contained in a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> file with default interleaving, resource, and compression options.
The path and file name of the target <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The file I/O mode in which to open the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> class that is contained in a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> with the specified default interleaving, resource, and compression options.
The target package for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The package compression option.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for the document as a string.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> class that is contained in a specified <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> file with default interleaving, resource, and compression options.
The path and file name of the target <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The file I/O mode in which to open the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The package compression option.
Adds a root <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to the package and returns a writer.
Although this class uses a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be a set (sequence) of one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or multiple documents.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] fixed-document sequence writer for this <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
Adds a thumbnail image to the package.
The format of the image.
The newly added <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsThumbnail"></xref>.
Closes the XPS document <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> was opened for write access, data buffers are written to the store and the physical document <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is closed.
After Close has been called, no parts of the document can be accessed with this <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> instance.
Gets the core <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties"></xref> of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document.
The core properties of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref><xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter"></xref> for writing an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to write.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter"></xref> to use for writing the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] document.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> and optionally, releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources that are held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedDocumentSequenceReader"></xref> for reading the document.
Although this class uses a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be a set (sequence) of one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or multiple documents.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedDocumentSequenceReader"></xref> for reading the document.
Returns the fixed-document sequence at the root of the package.
Although this class uses a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be a set (sequence) of one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or multiple documents.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> of the package.
Gets a value that indicates whether the package is readable.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the package is readable; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the package can be digitally signed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the package can be signed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the package is writable.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the package is writable; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Deletes a signature from the package.
The signature that is deleted.
Gets a collection of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] signatures that are associated with the package.
The Signatures list identifies what parts are signed and whether the signatures are valid.

A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature"></xref> objects that represent the signatures that are associated with the package.
Signs a collection of package parts with a specified X.509 certificate.
If `certificate` is `null`, a dialog box appears that enables the user to select an installed X.509 certificate, such as from a smart card reader.
The X.509 certificate to use in signing each part; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to prompt the user to select an installed certificate.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to store the certificate in the package; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Flags that indicate what dependent parts must be excluded from the signing.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature"></xref> that contains information about the signature.
Signs a collection of package parts by using a specified X.509 certificate.
If `certificate` is `null`, a dialog box appears that enables the user to select an installed X.509 certificate, such as from a smart card reader.
The X.509 certificate to use in signing each part; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to prompt the user to select an installed certificate.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to store the certificate in the package; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Flags that indicate what dependent parts are excluded from the signing.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_id](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-id-md.md)] to assign to the signature.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature"></xref> that contains information about the signature.
Signs a collection of package parts with a specified X.509 certificate.
If `certificate` is `null`, a dialog box is presented that enables the user to select an installed X.509 certificate, such as from a smart card reader.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if `certificate` is `null` and no certificates are installed.
The X.509 certificate to use in signing each part; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to prompt the user to select an installed certificate.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to store the certificate in the package; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Flags that indicate what dependent parts to exclude from the signing.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_id](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-id-md.md)] to assign to the signature.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to verify that <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.IsSignable*> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> before signing; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature"></xref> that contains information about the signature.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Use the type-safe <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.Dispose*> method instead.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] thumbnail image that is associated with the document.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsThumbnail"></xref> that represents the thumbnail image that is associated with the document.
